title: Quiz 2 - Pipes And Cistern
instruction: Each question contains a statement followed by Quantity I, Quantity II and Quantity III. Which of the following should be placed in the blank spaces of the expression “Quantity I__ Quantity II ___ Quantity III” from left to right with respect to the above statements?

quiz.text: If two pipes function together, the tank will be filled in 12 h. One pipe fills the tank in 10 h faster than the other. How many hours does the faster pipe take to fill up the tank?
options: 20 h
60 h
25 h
25 h
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes A and B can fill a tank in 4 min and 3 min, respectively. If both the pipes are opened together, after how much time pipe B should be closed so that the tank is full in 3 min?
options: 40 seconds
30 seconds
1 min
45 seconds
None of these

quiz.text: Two taps A and B can fill a tank in 25 min and 20 min, respectively. But taps are not opened properly, so the taps A and B allow 5/6th and 2/3rd part of water, respectively. How long will they take to fill the tank?
options: 12 min
13min
14 min
15 min
None of these

quiz.text: Three taps A, B, and C fill a tank in 20 min, 15 min, and 12 min, respectively. If all the taps are opened simultaneously, how long will they take to fill 40% of the tank?
options: 1 min
2 min
3 min
4 min
None of these

quiz.text: A cylindrical tank with a diameter of 25 cm is full of water. If 11 liters of water is drawn off, the water level in the tank will drop by?
options: 14 cm
12(6/7) cm
14 cm
22(2/5) cm
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes A and B can fill a tank in 36 hours and 45 hours respectively. If both the pipes are opened simultaneously, how much time will be taken to fill the tank?
options: 10 hrs
15 hrs
20 hrs
25 hrs
None of these

quiz.text: In what time would a cistern be filled by three pipes whose diameters are 1 cm, 1, 2 cm, running together, when the largest alone will fill it in 61 minutes, the amount of water flowing in by each pipe being proportional to the square of its diameter?
options: 32 minutes
34 minutes
36 minutes
38 minutes
None of these

quiz.text: If two pipes function simultaneously, the reservoir will be filled in 6 hours. One pipe fills the reservoir 5 hours faster than the other. How many hours does the faster pipe take to fill the reservoir?
options: 8 hrs
10 hrs
12 hrs
6 hrs
None of these

quiz.text: Three pipes A, B and C can fill cistern in 6 hrs. After working together for 2 hours, C is closed and A and B fill the cistern in 8 hrs. Then find the time in which the cistern can be filled by pipe C?
options: 6 hrs
12 hrs
14 hr
20 hrs
None of these

quiz.text: A cistern has two types . One can fill it in 8 h and other can empty it in 5 h. In how many hours will the cistern be emptied if both the pipes are opened together when 3/4th  of the cistern is already full of water?
options: 12 h
10 h
6 h
8 h
None of these

quiz.text: Pipes P and Q can fill a tank in 10 h and 12 h, respectively and C can empty it in 6 h. If all the three are opened at 7 am, at what time will one fourth of the tank be filled?
options: 10 am
10 pm
11 pm
11 am
None of these

quiz.text: A tap can fill a tank in 6 h. After half the tank is filled, three more similar taps are opened. What is the total time taken to fill the tank completely?
options: 4 h
4 h 15 min
3 h 15 min
3 h 45 min
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes A and B can fill a water tank in 20 min and 24 min, respectively and a third pipe C can empty at the rate of 3 gallons per min. If A, B and C opened together fill the tank in 15 min, the capacity (in gallons) of the tank is:
options: 180
150
120
60
None of these

quiz.text: A tap can fill a cistern in 40 min and a second tap can empty the filled cistern in 60 min. By mistake without closing the second tap, the first tap was opened. In how many minutes will the empty cistern be filled
options: 72 min
84 min
108 min
120 min
None of these

quiz.text: Pipe A can fill a cistern in 6 h and pipe B can fill it in 8 h. Both the pipes are opened simultaneously, but after 2 h, pipe A is closed. How many hours will B take to fill the remaining part of the cistern?
options: 2
3(1/3)
2(1/3)
4
None of these

quiz.text: Pipes P and Q can fill a tank in 10 and 12 h, respectively and C can empty it in 6 h. If all the three are opened at 7 am, at what time will one fourth of the tank be filled?
options: 10 am
10 pm
11 pm
11 am
None of these

quiz.text: A tap can fill an empty tank in 12 hours and another tap can empty the half filled tank in 10 hours. If both the taps are opened together then how much time it will take to fill an empty tank half filled?
options: 30 hours
20 hours
15 hours
12 hours
None of these

quiz.text: An oil drum can be filled with oil in 40 min by a filling pipe. An another outlet pipe can empty the entire drum in 60 min. The outlet pipe was opened when the 2/3 part of the drum was filled with oil and closed after 15 min. What time will it take to fill the drum when filling pipe is opened now?
options: 23(1/3)min
25(2/3)min
27(1/3)min
28(2/3)min
None of these

quiz.text: Two taps A and B can fill a water tank respectively in 24 and 28 min and a third tap C empties the tank at a speed of 5 gallon per min. It takes 16 min to fill the tank if A, B and C are opened together. The capacity of the tank is?
options: 380 gallon
350 gallon
336 gallon
360 gallon
None of these

quiz.text: Three taps P, Q and R separately can fill a tank completely in 4, 8 and 12 hours respectively. An another taps S can empty the filled tank in 10 hours. Which technique among the following will fill the empty tank in lesser time than other.
options: Q opened alone
P and S are opened
P, R and S are opened
P, Q and S are opened
None of these

quiz.text: A pipe can fill a tank in x h and another pipe can empty it in y (y>x) h. If both the pipes are open, in how many hours will the tank be filled?
options: (x – y) h
(y – x) h
xy/(x-y) h
xy/(y-x) h
None of these

quiz.text: A pipe can fill a tank with water in 3 h. Due to leakage in bottom, it takes 3.5 h to fill it. In what time the leak will empty the fully filled tank?
options: 12 h
21 h
6.5 h
10.5 h
None of these

quiz.text: A water tank has two pipes. The empty tank is filled in 12 min by the 1st and the, full tank is emptied by the 2nd in 20 min. The time required to fill the 1/3rd of the tank when both pipes are in action, is?
options: 16 min
10 min
20 min
15 min
None of these

quiz.text: Three taps are fitted to a cistern. The empty cistern is filled by the first and second taps in 3h and 4 h, respectively. The full cistern is emptied by the third tap in 5 h. If all three taps are opened simultaneously, the empty cistern will be filled up in?
options: 1(14/23) h
2(14/23) h
2 h 40 min
1 h 56 min
None of these

quiz.text: A tank can be filled by pipe A in 2 h and pipe B in 6 h. At 10 am pipe A was opened. At what time will the tank be filled if pipe B is opened at 11 am?
options: 12 : 45
5 pm
11 : 45
12 pm
None of these

quiz.text: An empty tank can be filled by pipe A in 4 h and by pipe B in 6 h. If the two pipes are opened for 1 h each alternately with first opening pipe A, then the tank will be filled in?
options: 1(3/4) h
2(3/5) h
4(2/3) h
5(1/2) h
None of these

quiz.text: A tank has two pipes. The first pipe can fill it in 45 minutes and the second can empty it in 1 hour. In what time will the empty tank be filled if the pipes be opened one at a time in alternate minutes?
options: 2 hrs 55 min
3 hrs 40 min
4 hrs 48 min
5 hrs 53 min
None of these

quiz.text: A tank can be filled by a tap in 20 min and by another tap in 60 min. Both the taps are kept open for 5 min and then the 1st tap is shut off. After this, how much time the tank will be completely filled?
options: 20 min
30 min
45 min
40 min
None of these

quiz.text: A cistern has three pipes A, B and C. Pipes A and B can fill it in 3 h and 4 h, respectively, while pipe C can empty the completely filled cistern in 1 h. If pipes are opened in order at 3:00 pm, 4:00 pm and 5:00 pm, respectively, at what time will the cistern be empty?
options: 6 : 15 pm
7 : 12 pm
8 : 12 pm
8 : 35 pm
None of these

quiz.text: Three pipes A, B and C can fill a tank in 30 min, 20 min and 10 min, respectively. When the tank is empty, all the three pipes are opened. If A, B and C discharge chemical solutions P, Q and R respectively, then the part of solution R in the liquid in the tank after 3 min is:
options: 8/11
5/11
6/11
7/11
None of these

quiz.text: If on Monday pipe M works with a efficiency of 120 % and both pipe M and P on Monday remained open for 7 minutes but alternatively on each minute starting with M. Remaining part of the tank is filled on next day. What is the total time for which pipe P remained open on both days if next day all pipes filled the tank together?
options: 12 min 15 sec
16 min 18 sec
18 min 15 sec
17 min 12 sec
20 min 10 sec

quiz.text: On Wednesday tank is filled by both pipes working simultaneously but on Thursday all pipes work alternatively on each minute starting from pipe N then O and then P. Find the difference in time taken to fill the tank on Wednesday and the time taken to fill tank on Thursday.
options: 5 min
18 min
15 min
20 min
25 min

quiz.text: If on Friday 36 litre of water per minute is filled by both the pipes then, amount of water filled by pipe P on Monday is what percent of amount of water filled by pipe Q on Friday.
options: 80%
95%
90%
80%
75%

quiz.text: On Friday M worked with 120% of its efficiency and Q with 75% of its efficiency and they together can fill 162 litre of water in 12 min. On Monday if both the pipes (M and P) are working with a different efficiency then both pipes working together can fill 7/30 part of the tank in 8 min and if M is opened for 8 min and P is opened for 15 min then they can fill 157.5 litre of water. Find the ratio of time taken by M alone and time taken by P alone to fill tank according to new efficiency on Monday.
options: 2 : 3
4 : 3
3 : 4
5 : 3
3 : 5

quiz.text: If rate of flow of pipe N is 18 litre/min, and cost incurred in filling 1 litre of water in the tank by pipe N, O and P is 12 Rs./L, 15 Rs./L and 10 Rs./L respectively, then find the total cost incurred in filling the tank on Tuesday if all the pipes filled the tank simultaneously.
options: Rs. 10,665
Rs. 11,552
Rs. 12,666
Rs. 9,848
Rs. 8,440

quiz.text: To fill a tank, pipes A and C were opened at 2:10 PM. After 5 minutes pipe A was closed and at the same time pipe P got opened. After some time it was found that tank was 2/3rd empty, at what time it was observed?
options: 2:32 PM
2:30 PM
2:27 PM
2:35 PM
2:20 PM

quiz.text: A tank was 2/5th full. To fill it more, pipe D was to be opened, but accidentally pipe Q got opened. When it was noticed after 4 minutes, pipe Q was closed. And now to fill tank quickly, pipe C was opened. What time could have been saved if pipe Q was not opened?
options: 7.45 minutes
5.35 minutes
5.25 minutes
8.35 minutes
7.25 minutes

quiz.text: There was some garbage in a tank. To remove the garbage, pipes A and R worked alternately for 3 minutes each starting with A. The procedure continued for 24 minutes, after which pipes A and D were opened to fill the tank. If the tank was filled in next 7 minutes, find the time in which pipe R can empty the full tank.
options: 24 minutes
28 minutes
18 minutes
20 minutes
32 minutes

quiz.text: A tank is to be filled by using pipes B and D simultaneously. After 9 minutes, some garbage was observed in tank so pipes B and D were closed and pipe S was opened. After 6 minutes, it was found, that tank is clean so pipe S was closed and again pipes B and D were opened, after which they filled the tank in 6 minutes. If pipe S alone can empty 2/9th tank in 4 minutes, in how much time pipe B can fill the fill tank?
options: 20 minutes
16 minutes
15 minutes
24 minutes
18 minutes

quiz.text: Using the data from table and above questions, which of the following combination of pipes will fill the tank in less time as compared to other combinations given?
options: A-B-S
B-C-P
A-D-Q
A-B-P
B-D-R

quiz.text: If due to weakness, the efficiency of Deepika and Eli are decreased by 12.5% and 10% respectively, then how much time Bipasha, Deepika and Eli will take to fill the empty tank when they work simultaneously?
options: 9 (13/43) hours
8 (3/43) hours
8 (36/43) hours
9(33/43) hours
Other than above

quiz.text: If Amir and Govinda starts filling the tank and then Chetan and fawad starts emptying it simultaneously, then how many hours are required to fill the tank completely?
options: 41 (27/43)
40 (40/43)
42 (26/43)
41 (37/43)
None of the above.

quiz.text: Ranbir can fill 250% more tank in 1 hour than tank filled by Deepika in 1 hour and Shahid can fill 125% more tank in 1 hour than tank filled by Eli in 1 hour. If Govinda starts filling the tank and stops after some time and then Ranbir and Shahid starts filling it and they take 30 minutes more than the time for which Govinda had worked and the tank is filled completely, then how much total time was taken to fill the tank?
options: 9.3 hours
4.5 hours
9.5 hours
6 hours
5 hours

quiz.text: If Amir, Chetan and Govinda starts filling the tank and Deepika and Fawad starts used to emptying it, then approximately what percent of the total tank is filled in 1 hour?
options: 6.2%
10.32%
12%
9.40%
None of these

quiz.text:
A tank is filtered with two inlet pipes A and B. Both the pipes are kept open for 10 minutes so that the tank is 2/3rd full and then pipe A is closed. How much time will B take to fill the remaining part of the tank?

 

I. Pipe A is thrice as fast as pipe B. 

II. Pipe B alone can fill the tank in 60 minutes.
options: I alone sufficient while II alone not sufficient to answer
II alone sufficient while I alone not sufficient to answer
Either I or II alone sufficient to answer
Both I and II are not sufficient to answer
Both I and II are necessary to answer

quiz.text:
Two taps A and B , when opened together, can fill a tank in 6 hours. How long will it take for the pipe A alone to fill the tank ?

 

I. B alone take 5 hours more than A to fill the tank. 

II. The ratio of the time taken by A to that taken by B to fill the tank is 2:3
options: I alone sufficient while II alone not sufficient to answer
II alone sufficient while I alone not sufficient to answer
Either I or II alone sufficient to answer
Both I and II are not sufficient to answer
Both I and II are necessary to answer

quiz.text:
A tank is fitted with two taps A and B. In how much time will the tank be full if both the taps are opened together ?

 

I. A is 50% more efficient than B. 

II. A alone takes 16 hours to fill the tank. 

III. B alone takes 24 hours to fill the tank.
options: II and III only
All I, II and III
I and II only
I and III only
Any two of the three

quiz.text:
If both the pipes are opened, how many hours will be taken to fill the tank?

 

I. The capacity of the tank is 400 litres.

II. The pipe A fills the tank in 4 hours.

III. The pipe B fills the tank in 6 hours.
options: Only I and II
Only II and III
All I, II and III
Any two of the three
Even with all the three statements, answer cannot be given.

quiz.text:
How much time will the leak take to empty the full cistern?

 

I. The cistern is normally filled in 9 hours. 

II. It takes one hour more than the usual time to fill the cistern because of the leak at the bottom.
options: I alone sufficient while II alone not sufficient to answer
II alone sufficient while I alone not sufficient to answer
Either I or II alone sufficient to answer
Both I and II are not sufficient to answer
Both I and II are necessary to answer

quiz.text:
How long will it take to empty the tank if both the inlet pipe A and the outlet pipe B are opened simultaneously?

 

I. A can fill the tank in 16 minutes. 

II. B can empty the full tank in 8 minutes.
options: I alone sufficient while II alone not sufficient to answer
II alone sufficient while I alone not sufficient to answer
Either I or II alone sufficient to answer
Both I and II are not sufficient to answer
Both I and II are necessary to answer

quiz.text: Pipe A fill the tank in _____ hours and Pipe B in 40 hours but Pipe C can empty the tank in 50 hours. If starting with Pipe A, followed by Pipe B and Pipe C, each Pipe opens alternatively, then the tank fill completely in ______hours.
options: 40, 81(17/25)
36, 80(17/26)
32, 81(17/25)
Either b or c
None of these

quiz.text: Pipe P can fill a cistern in 40 minutes. With the help of pipe Q, it can fill the cistern in 15 minutes. Pipe R can fill the cistern in 20 minutes. An emptying pipe S can empty the full cistern in 60 minutes. Quantity I: Pipe P and pipe R are opened for 5 minutes and then closed. In what time pipe S can empty the filled part of the tank? Quantity II: Find the time taken by pipe P, pipe Q and pipe R to fill the tank together. Quantity III: Pipe Q is opened for 12 minutes and then closed. In what time pipe S can empty the filled part of the tank?
options: <, =
=, =
≤, ≥
<, >
>, >
